alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:17PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Gallatin County through 415 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Three Forks, or 23 miles northwest of Bozeman, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Logan, Amsterdam, Trident, Church Hill, Willow Creek, Menard, Madison Buffalo Jump State Park and Missouri Headwaters State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 277 and 299. Highway 287 between mile markers 82 and 83, and between mile markers 90 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for south central and southwestern Montana.
